questions.question: A car accelerates from rest at a rate of $2.5 \, \text{m/s}^2$ for $10 \, \text{s}$. What is its final velocity?
questions.correctAnswer: $$25 \, \text{m/s}$$ 1. Use the kinematic formula for velocity: $$v = u + at$$ 2. Substitute the values into the formula: $$v = 0 + (2.5 \, \text{m/s}^2)(10 \, \text{s})$$ 3. Calculate the final velocity: $$v = 25 \, \text{m/s}$$

questions.question: A baseball with a mass of $0.15 \, \text{kg}$ is thrown with a force of $12 \, \text{N}$. What is the acceleration of the baseball?
questions.correctAnswer: $$80 \, \text{m/s}^2$$ 1. Use Newton's Second Law: $$F = ma$$ 2. Rearrange to solve for acceleration: $$a = \frac{F}{m}$$ 3. Substitute the values: $$a = \frac{12 \, \text{N}}{0.15 \, \text{kg}}$$ 4. Calculate the acceleration: $$a = 80 \, \text{m/s}^2$$

questions.question: A box is pushed with a force of $200 \, \text{N}$ over a distance of $5 \, \text{m}$. How much work is done?
questions.correctAnswer: $$1000 \, \text{J}$$ 1. Use the formula for work: $$W = F \times d$$ 2. Substitute the values: $$W = 200 \, \text{N} \times 5 \, \text{m}$$ 3. Calculate the work done: $$W = 1000 \, \text{J}$$

questions.question: A hydraulic lift has an input piston with an area of $0.02 \, \text{m}^2$ and an output piston with an area of $0.8 \, \text{m}^2$. If a force of $50 \, \text{N}$ is applied to the input piston, what is the output force?
questions.correctAnswer: $$2000 \, \text{N}$$ 1. Use Pascal's Principle: $$\frac{F_1}{A_1} = \frac{F_2}{A_2}$$ 2. Rearrange to solve for output force: $$F_2 = F_1 \times \frac{A_2}{A_1}$$ 3. Substitute the values: $$F_2 = 50 \, \text{N} \times \frac{0.8 \, \text{m}^2}{0.02 \, \text{m}^2}$$ 4. Calculate the output force: $$F_2 = 2000 \, \text{N}$$

questions.question: A $12 \, \text{V}$ battery is connected to a resistor. If the circuit has a current of $2000 \, \text{mA}$, what is the resistance of the resistor?
questions.correctAnswer: $$6 \, \Omega$$ 1. Convert the current from milliamperes to amperes: $$2000 \, \text{mA} = 2 \, \text{A}$$ 2. Use Ohm's Law: $$R = \frac{V}{I}$$ 3. Substitute the values: $$R = \frac{12 \, \text{V}}{2 \, \text{A}}$$ 4. Calculate the resistance: $$R = 6 \, \Omega$$

questions.question: A $2 \, \text{kg}$ object is dropped from a height of $5 \, \text{m}$. What is its potential energy just before it is dropped? (Use $g = 9.8 \, \text{m/s}^2$)
questions.correctAnswer: $$98 \, \text{J}$$ 1. Use the formula for potential energy: $$PE = mgh$$ 2. Substitute the values: $$PE = (2 \, \text{kg})(9.8 \, \text{m/s}^2)(5 \, \text{m})$$ 3. Calculate the potential energy: $$PE = 98 \, \text{J}$$

questions.question: A pulley system lifts a $50 \, \text{kg}$ mass with an applied force of $100 \, \text{N}$. What is the mechanical advantage? (Use $g = 9.8 \, \text{m/s}^2$)
questions.correctAnswer: $$4.9$$ 1. Calculate the output force ($$F_{out}$$), which is the weight of the mass: $$F_{out} = mg = (50 \, \text{kg})(9.8 \, \text{m/s}^2) = 490 \, \text{N}$$ 2. Use the formula for mechanical advantage: $$MA = \frac{F_{out}}{F_{in}}$$ 3. Substitute the values: $$MA = \frac{490 \, \text{N}}{100 \, \text{N}}$$ 4. Calculate the mechanical advantage: $$MA = 4.9$$

questions.question: An electric appliance uses $120 \, \text{V}$ and draws a current of $3000 \, \text{mA}$. What is its power consumption?
questions.correctAnswer: $$360 \, \text{W}$$ 1. Convert the current from milliamperes to amperes: $$3000 \, \text{mA} = 3 \, \text{A}$$ 2. Use the formula for power: $$P = VI$$ 3. Substitute the values: $$P = (120 \, \text{V})(3 \, \text{A})$$ 4. Calculate the power consumption: $$P = 360 \, \text{W}$$

questions.question: A person walks $50 \, \text{m}$ to the east, then $30 \, \text{m}$ to the north. What is the magnitude of their displacement?
questions.correctAnswer: $$58.3 \, \text{m}$$ 1. Use the Pythagorean theorem to find the magnitude of the displacement ($$d$$): $$d = \sqrt{a^2 + b^2}$$ 2. Substitute the values: $$d = \sqrt{(50 \, \text{m})^2 + (30 \, \text{m})^2} = \sqrt{2500 + 900} = \sqrt{3400}$$ 3. Calculate the final displacement: $$d \approx 58.3 \, \text{m}$$

questions.question: A wheel has a radius of $0.5 \, \text{m}$ and is rotating at $2 \, \text{rad/s}$. What is the linear velocity of a point on its edge?
questions.correctAnswer: $$1 \, \text{m/s}$$ 1. Use the relationship between linear and angular velocity: $$v = r\omega$$ 2. Substitute the values: $$v = (0.5 \, \text{m})(2 \, \text{rad/s})$$ 3. Calculate the linear velocity: $$v = 1 \, \text{m/s}$$

questions.question: If $200 \, \text{J}$ of work is done on a machine and the output work is $150 \, \text{J}$, what is the efficiency of the machine?
questions.correctAnswer: $$75\%$$ 1. Use the formula for efficiency: $$Efficiency = \frac{W_{out}}{W_{in}} \times 100\%$$ 2. Substitute the values: $$Efficiency = \frac{150 \, \text{J}}{200 \, \text{J}} \times 100\%$$ 3. Calculate the efficiency: $$Efficiency = 0.75 \times 100\% = 75\%$$

questions.question: A $5 \, \text{kg}$ object is moving at $10 \, \text{m/s}$. What is its kinetic energy?
questions.correctAnswer: $$250 \, \text{J}$$ 1. Use the formula for kinetic energy: $$KE = \frac{1}{2}mv^2$$ 2. Substitute the values: $$KE = \frac{1}{2}(5 \, \text{kg})(10 \, \text{m/s})^2$$ 3. Calculate the kinetic energy: $$KE = \frac{1}{2}(5)(100) = 250 \, \text{J}$$

questions.question: A force of $5 \, \text{N}$ is applied to a piston with an area of $0.01 \, \text{m}^2$. What is the pressure exerted on the fluid?
questions.correctAnswer: $$500 \, \text{Pa}$$ 1. Use the formula for pressure: $$P = \frac{F}{A}$$ 2. Substitute the values: $$P = \frac{5 \, \text{N}}{0.01 \, \text{m}^2}$$ 3. Calculate the pressure: $$P = 500 \, \text{Pa}$$

questions.question: A motor performs $600 \, \text{J}$ of work in $2 \, \text{s}$. What is the power of the motor?
questions.correctAnswer: $$300 \, \text{W}$$ 1. Use the formula for power: $$P = \frac{W}{t}$$ 2. Substitute the values: $$P = \frac{600 \, \text{J}}{2 \, \text{s}}$$ 3. Calculate the power: $$P = 300 \, \text{W}$$

questions.question: What is the buoyant force on a $0.5 \, \text{m}^3$ block submerged in water? (The density of water is $1000 \, \text{kg/m}^3$ and $g = 9.8 \, \text{m/s}^2$)
questions.correctAnswer: $$4900 \, \text{N}$$ 1. Use the formula for buoyant force: $$F_b = \rho V g$$ 2. Substitute the values: $$F_b = (1000 \, \text{kg/m}^3)(0.5 \, \text{m}^3)(9.8 \, \text{m/s}^2)$$ 3. Calculate the buoyant force: $$F_b = 4900 \, \text{N}$$

questions.question: A $1.5 \, \text{V}$ cell supplies a current of $200 \, \text{mA}$ to a small bulb. What is the power consumed by the bulb?
questions.correctAnswer: $$0.3 \, \text{W}$$ 1. Convert the current from milliamperes to amperes: $$200 \, \text{mA} = 0.2 \, \text{A}$$ 2. Use the formula for power: $$P = VI$$ 3. Substitute the values: $$P = (1.5 \, \text{V})(0.2 \, \text{A})$$ 4. Calculate the power consumed: $$P = 0.3 \, \text{W}$$

questions.question: How much time does it take a car to travel a distance of $150 \, \text{km}$ at an average speed of $75 \, \text{km/h}$?
questions.correctAnswer: $$2 \, \text{hours}$$ 1. Use the formula for time: $$t = \frac{d}{s}$$ 2. Substitute the values: $$t = \frac{150 \, \text{km}}{75 \, \text{km/h}}$$ 3. Calculate the time taken: $$t = 2 \, \text{hours}$$

questions.question: A block of wood with a volume of $0.01 \, \text{m}^3$ has a mass of $5 \, \text{kg}$. What is its density?
questions.correctAnswer: $$500 \, \text{kg/m}^3$$ 1. Use the formula for density: $$\rho = \frac{m}{V}$$ 2. Substitute the values: $$\rho = \frac{5 \, \text{kg}}{0.01 \, \text{m}^3}$$ 3. Calculate the density: $$\rho = 500 \, \text{kg/m}^3$$

questions.question: A crane lifts a $1000 \, \text{kg}$ crate to a height of $5 \, \text{m}$. How much potential energy is gained by the crate? (Use $g = 9.8 \, \text{m/s}^2$)
questions.correctAnswer: $$49000 \, \text{J}$$ 1. Use the formula for potential energy: $$PE = mgh$$ 2. Substitute the values: $$PE = (1000 \, \text{kg})(9.8 \, \text{m/s}^2)(5 \, \text{m})$$ 3. Calculate the potential energy: $$PE = 49000 \, \text{J}$$

questions.question: A resistor has a voltage of $10 \, \text{V}$ across it and a resistance of $5 \, \Omega$. What is the current flowing through it in milliamperes?
questions.correctAnswer: $$2000 \, \text{mA}$$ 1. Use Ohm's Law to find the current in amperes: $$I = \frac{V}{R} = \frac{10 \, \text{V}}{5 \, \Omega} = 2 \, \text{A}$$ 2. Convert the current from amperes to milliamperes: $$I = 2 \, \text{A} \times 1000 = 2000 \, \text{mA}$$ 3. The final current is $$2000 \, \text{mA}$$

questions.question: What is the total voltage of four $1.5 \, \text{V}$ batteries connected in series?
questions.correctAnswer: $$6.0 \, \text{V}$$ 1. To find the total voltage, add the voltages of all batteries in series: $$V_{total} = V_1 + V_2 + V_3 + V_4$$ 2. Since the batteries are identical, this simplifies to: $$V_{total} = 4 \times 1.5 \, \text{V}$$ 3. The total voltage is $$6.0 \, \text{V}$$

questions.question: Four $1.5 \, \text{V}$ batteries are connected in series to a $12 \, \Omega$ resistor. What is the total current in milliamperes?
questions.correctAnswer: $$500 \, \text{mA}$$ 1. Find the total voltage of the batteries in series: $$V_{total} = 4 \times 1.5 \, \text{V} = 6 \, \text{V}$$ 2. Use Ohm's Law to find the current in amperes: $$I = \frac{V_{total}}{R} = \frac{6 \, \text{V}}{12 \, \Omega} = 0.5 \, \text{A}$$ 3. Convert the current from amperes to milliamperes: $$I = 0.5 \, \text{A} \times 1000 = 500 \, \text{mA}$$ 4. The total current is $$500 \, \text{mA}$$

questions.question: A circuit has a current of $500 \, \text{mA}$. What is this current in Amperes?
questions.correctAnswer: $$0.5 \, \text{A}$$ 1. Use the conversion factor: $$1000 \, \text{mA} = 1 \, \text{A}$$ 2. To convert milliamperes to amperes, divide by 1000: $$I = \frac{500 \, \text{mA}}{1000} = 0.5 \, \text{A}$$ 3. The current in amperes is $$0.5 \, \text{A}$$

questions.question: A device has a voltage of $6 \, \text{V}$ and draws a current of $1500 \, \text{mA}$. What is its power consumption in Watts?
questions.correctAnswer: $$9.0 \, \text{W}$$ 1. Convert the current from milliamperes to amperes: $$1500 \, \text{mA} = 1.5 \, \text{A}$$ 2. Use the formula for power: $$P = VI$$ 3. Substitute the values: $$P = (6 \, \text{V})(1.5 \, \text{A})$$ 4. Calculate the power consumption: $$P = 9.0 \, \text{W}$$

questions.question: What is the total voltage of two $1.5 \, \text{V}$ batteries connected in parallel?
questions.correctAnswer: $$1.5 \, \text{V}$$ 1. When identical voltage sources are connected in parallel, the total voltage across the circuit is the same as the voltage of a single source 2. The total voltage is $$1.5 \, \text{V}$$
